Key Arguments: The bill infringes on freedom of speech and could lead to government overreach.
Definitions of misinformation and disinformation are ambiguous and subjective.
The bill could cause a chilling effect, leading to over-censorship by platforms.
There is potential for political bias in enforcement, favoring certain viewpoints.
Smaller platforms may struggle with compliance, unlike larger tech companies.
The legislation could unintentionally suppress legitimate content like satire or opinion.
Enforcement may require increased surveillance, raising privacy concerns.
The bill represents government overreach and control over online communication.
Notable Quotes: The bill infringes on the right to freedom of speech, a fundamental tenet of democratic societies.
Much better for ideas to be debated in the open without Government interference.
In practice, anything which isn’t left leaning will be labelled ‘far right’ and banned.
Indeed, it’s almost as though the government is following the George Orwell script in his novel 1984.
